definition: emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain

sentences.english: And he gave me a taste of the joys and vanities of ownership.
sentences.chinese: 这让我尝到了拥有一个小商业的快乐和虚荣。

sentences.english: BEFORE the advent of male vanity, the local barbershop used to be a regaling hotspot.
sentences.chinese: 由于男性的虚荣心，当地的理发馆一直以来生意兴隆。

sentences.english: It is very often nothing but our own vanity that deceives us.
sentences.chinese: 我们往往会因为我们自己的虚荣心，而给弄迷了心窍。

sentences.english: Extravagance and vanity had made him coldhearted and selfish.
sentences.chinese: 放荡和虚荣使他变得残忍自私。

sentences.english: My poet's vanity dies in shame before thy sight.
sentences.chinese: 我的诗人的虚荣心，在你的容光中羞死。

sentences.english: Finally a vanity tool that doesnâ€™t despise you!
sentences.chinese: 终于，一面满足你虚荣心的工具不再轻视你。

sentences.english: You'll only make his vanity worse if you tell him how handsome he is.
sentences.chinese: 你告诉他他长的有多帅只会让他的虚荣心更严重。

sentences.english: His vanity is boorish and fraudulent.
sentences.chinese: 他的虚荣是粗野和欺骗的。

sentences.english: Our own vanity is the worst flatterer.
sentences.chinese: 我们的虚荣心是最坏的奉承者。
她挖苦的语言刺伤了他的虚荣心。

sentences.english: Yes, I admitted that I am a peacockish person.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我承认我是一个虚荣心强的人。

sentences.english: How can you expend your parents' money to fulfill your vainglory ?!
sentences.chinese: 你怎么可以用父母的钱来满足自己的虚荣呢？

sentences.english: These things help us to be humble and shield us from vainglory .
sentences.chinese: 这些事都能帮助我们谦逊，保护我们不受虚荣之害。

sentences.english: Standing free from dependence, conception, and self-conceit is the mark of liberation.
sentences.chinese: 常设摆脱依赖，概念，和自我虚荣心是解放的标志。

sentences.english: Praise shames me, for I secretly beg for it.
sentences.chinese: 荣耀使我感到羞愧，因为我的虚荣打算乘虚作乱。

sentences.english: Then Love decided to ask Vanity for help who was passing by in a beautiful vessel.
sentences.chinese: 于是，爱决定向开着华丽大船驶过这里的虚荣求助。

definition: to worship money/to be mad about money
to make invidious comparisons/to compete with/to emulate
to like to look good in the eyes of others/sensitive about how one is regarded by others/proud
